Column Comment.0: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.1: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.2: SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique number indicating the service that wasprovided
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE TYPE: A valid list of services for a businessassociate. For example well logger, drilling contractor, application developer. Forland, may be may be address for service, brokerage, maintainor etc.
Column Comment.5: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who is the contact for this service.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: text description of the service that was provided.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: END DATE: the date that this service was completed.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: ORIGINAL PARTY NAME: The name of party as it was when the service wasprovided, in text form.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique code identifying the provision in the contract.(could be same as clause number e.g. 16 or entered as 16 even though clause isactually numbered XVI - facilitates easier query)
Column Comment.13: RATE AND FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.14: REMARK: a text description about the service provided by a Business Associate for acontract.
Column Comment.15: REPRESENTED BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: The unique identifier for the BA onwhose bahalf the service was provided.
Column Comment.16: SERVICE QUALITY: The quality of service provided by this BUSINESSASSOCIATE, either for a specified address, a service or a service at an address.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: START DATE: the date that this service was started.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
